entry.title: Things I’m grateful for
entry.content:
Things I like about living in the US:

  • The freedom to untie my hair, wear shorts, eat meat and be with whomever I please
  • Long empty sidewalks to run for miles and miles, even trails
  • Thrift stores abundant with beautiful cheap things
  • Probably milder workplace politics than what I’ve been told about various other places

Things I like about CMU:

  • In 11th grade, I attended a 2 day math camp before the INMO. I thought it would be a dream to do that everyday.
  • In 12th grade, I loved OCW and thought it would be surreal to be a part of those live lectures.
  • Today these things are largely the realities of my life.

entry.title: How I Learned to Love Exercise

link.title: How I Learned to Love Exercise

entry.content:
In May 2020, exercise was one of those things I knew I should do but mostly didn’t. Like everyone else stuck at home during COVID, I tried Couch to 5K—it was a whole trend, right? People were running in their neighborhoods because what else were you going to do.

[opening paragraph about early attempts - to be filled in]

Fast forward to now—it’s 2025, I run 30 miles a week and genuinely look forward to it, and I broke a two-year bench press plateau going from 50 to 90 pounds. I still can’t quite believe I’m someone who does this voluntarily, but here we are.

What Actually Happened

[Fill in: May 2021 - long bikes made me sad, switched to running apps] [Fill in: August 2021 - bought Zena audiobook, discovered Caroline Girvan workouts, loved them] [Fill in: November 2021 - downloaded weights app, busy with PhD applications] [Fill in: February 2022 - grad school visits, decided to join gym, watched "gym etiquette" YouTube videos] [Fill in: March 2023 - plateau, rotator cuff injury, rock climbing with friends] [Fill in: September/October 2023 - first 5K race, discovered Pilates/fitness channels] [Fill in: March 2025 - met powerlifting boyfriend, broke bench plateau from 50 to 90 pounds] [Fill in: June 2025 - summer at gym, running went from 10 mi/week to 30 mi/week]

[Section title - to be filled in]

[Reflections/takeaways based on the journey - to be filled in]

Where I’m At Now

Five years ago, my relationship with exercise was “not fun, not consistent.” Now I run 30 miles a week, I’m breaking PRs on my lifts, and I actually look forward to workouts. I still can’t quite believe that’s true.

[Closing thoughts - to be filled in]
entry.summary: From Couch to 5K during COVID to actually running 30 miles a week five years later. Spoiler: I tried a lot of things I hated first.
